body_content.explanation: the middle class (= the social group between the rich and the poor), especially the people thought to have a strong interest in supporting traditional customs and values:
examples: The new bourgeoisie, which was created by the Industrial Revolution, had money to spend and wanted to travel.
The bourgeoisie were rising in economic power and cultural confidence.
His father, who was a wealthy merchant and farmer, belonged to the local bourgeoisie.

body_content.explanation: (in Marxism) the part of society, including employers and people who run large companies, that has most of the money and power which it gets from the work of ordinary people :
examples: Without their control over the workers, the bourgeoisie could not remain in power.
Marx criticized the hypocritical behaviour of the liberal bourgeoisie.
The peasant revolution was rejected by the bourgeoisie but supported by the industrial proletariat.
